newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal sets May EDP privatisation -- paper.
newsitem.headline: Portugal sets May EDP privatisation -- paper.

text.p: The privatisation of state electricity company EDP is set for mid-May, probably May 19, and could involve up to 49 percent of the capital, the weekly Expresso newspaper reported.

The newspaper quoted Finance Ministry number two Fernando Teixeira dos Santos as saying that the government intended to introduce the greatest degree of flexibility possible into the percentage of capital to be sold.

The secretary of state for the Treasury and Finance said that the goal for the privatisation remained 20 to 25 percent of EDP's capital, which would still be the largest single privatisation carried out in Portugal.
But the government was prepared to sell more if the demand were there, the paper quoted him as saying.
By law, the government cannot sell off more than 49 percent.
Teixeira dos Santos said that the government was considering incentives for domestic investors but he gave no details.

There was also the possibility of introducing a bonus for investors who held stock bought at the privatisation for at least a year. The bonus might involve the granting of a free share for every 20 held, the newspaper said.
